newsitem.title: USA: Protocol sees Q1 revs, net under forecast.
newsitem.headline: Protocol sees Q1 revs, net under forecast.

text.p: Protocol Systems Inc said Tuesday its first quarter revenues will be about $2.5 million short of earlier forecasts, while earnings will be "significantly below" expectations.

The company did not specify what forecasts it was referring to. However, the mean analyst estimate is for first quarter earnings of $0.12 per share, compared with $0.17 last year, according to First Call.
Protocol said sales were hurt by customer delays and cutbacks in capital spending resulting from the healthcare industry's transition to managed care practices.

In addition to those factors, it said earnings were hurt by about $250,000 in warranty expense incurred in a voluntary recall of a component on one of its monitoring instruments. It said the recalled component showed a high failure rate in about 1,500 of its Propaq Encore monitors.
